[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Key persistence] Is the mint.key file properly protected with restricted file permissions, or can any local user read the private key and mint unlimited tokens? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Key generation] If mint.key doesn't exist, is there secure key generation logic elsewhere, or can an attacker race to create a malicious key file before the legitimate initialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Key rotation] Does the system support key rotation for mint.key, or would changing the key require complete testnet reinitialization potentially causing loss of state? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Key backup] Can the mint.key be accidentally backed up to version control or backups, exposing the private key material to unauthorized parties? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Delegation bypass] When do_not_delegate is set to true (line 61), does this expose the root account's private key to more transaction operations, increasing the attack surface for key compromise? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Delegation failure] If delegation is enabled but fails during initialization, does the faucet gracefully fall back or does it enter an inconsistent state where minting is impossible? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Account creation race] Can there be race conditions during delegated account creation where multiple faucet instances attempt to create and claim the same delegated account? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Interface binding] Does bind_to parameter properly restrict which network interfaces the faucet listens on, or can misconfiguration expose the faucet to external networks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [IPv4 only] The bind_to parameter is typed as Ipv4Addr (line 51), does this prevent IPv6 binding, potentially causing service failures in IPv6-only environments? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Privileged ports] Can faucet_port be set to a privileged port (<1024) requiring root privileges, creating security issues if the service runs with elevated permissions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Struct: FaucetManager] [Clone safety] The FaucetManager derives Clone (line 41), but does cloning the config field properly handle internal state like sequence numbers, or can clones create inconsistent faucet states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Struct: FaucetManager] [Concurrent access] Are prerequisite_health_checkers properly synchronized for concurrent access, or can race conditions during health checking cause incorrect service state determinations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Test directory security] Does the test_dir parameter get validated to ensure it's not pointing to sensitive system directories like /etc or /root? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Directory creation] If test_dir doesn't exist, is it created with proper permissions, or can this be exploited for directory traversal or permission escalation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Chain ID validation] Is there validation that node_api_url's chain ID matches the expected local testnet chain ID, or can the faucet be tricked into minting on the wrong chain? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: run_service()] [Shutdown handling] Does the async run_service properly handle shutdown signals, or can abrupt termination leave the faucet in an inconsistent state with pending transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: run_service()] [Restart safety] If the faucet service crashes and restarts, are sequence numbers and outstanding transaction tracking properly recovered, or can this lead to double-minting or failed transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: run_service()] [Resource cleanup] When run_service completes or errors, are all resources (network sockets, file handles, async tasks) properly cleaned up to prevent resource leaks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Config defaults] Does RunConfig::build_for_cli use secure defaults, or can the default configuration (no checkers, no bypassers) allow unrestricted faucet abuse? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Metrics exposure] Is the metrics server properly disabled in build_for_cli to prevent information disclosure about faucet operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [API path validation] Does build_for_cli properly set the api_path_base, or can path confusion allow unauthorized access to faucet endpoints? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Result unwrapping] Are all Result types properly handled throughout the call chain, or can panics from unwrap() crash the local testnet? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Error context] Do errors propagated from deeper layers provide sufficient context to diagnose security-relevant failures like key loading errors or network binding failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: get_health_checkers()] [HashSet iteration order] Since HashSet has undefined iteration order, can this cause non-deterministic health checking behavior that could be exploited for race conditions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: get_prerequisite_health_checkers()] [Reference collection] Does collecting references from prerequisite_health_checkers create lifetime issues or allow mutation of health checkers during checking? (Low)
